availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, attorney. Married to Julia T. Wickliffe on October 16, 1855. Father of Charles Beckham, Maggie Beckham, and Nannie Beckham. Attorney in Nelson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 197.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 111B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, Bardstown District No. 1, p. 17B.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Film # 000481490, Nelson County, October 16, 1855.
The National Cyclopædia of American Biography, vol. 13, (New York: James T. White & Company, 1906), 14.
Find A Grave, "William Netherton Beckham,” Memorial #126079109, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/126079109/william-netherton-beckham (accessed February 11, 2019).
